member.name: T:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler
member.summary: A console prompt keyboard handler that acts like the text editor on the Commodore 64 and VIC-20 computers.
member.remarks: This handler lets the user move the cursor with the keyboard arrow keys. When the ENTER key is pressed, the current line is sent to the callback. All empty characters are trimmed from the start and end of the string.

member.name: P:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.Prompt
member.summary: The prompt to display to the user.

member.name: P:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.EraseGlyph
member.summary: The glyph to print when erasing a character, such as when the backspace key is pressed to erase a character.

member.name: P:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.ReplaceEmptyGlyph
member.summary: The glyph used to replace the empty characters that may be in the string sent to .

member.name: F:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.EnterPressedAction
member.summary: This is a callback for the owner of this keyboard handler. When it returns , the handler will print the prompt. The parameters are the component itself, the used by the handler, and the string input by the user. It's called when the user presses ENTER.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new keyboard handler with the specified prompt.
member.param: The prompt to display to the user.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.OnAdded(SadConsole.IScreenObject)
member.summary: Called when this component is added to an object with a cursor; caches reference to the cursor.
member.param: The host object for the component.
member.remarks:
Makes the cursor visible, disables word breaks and the string parser, and prints the prompt.
If the host is a , it uses the property, caching reference to it. You can't change the cursor reference unless you re-add this component. If the host is a , the first instance of a cursor in the collection is used. If there is no cursor, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Components.C64KeyboardHandler.PrintPrompt
member.summary: Prints the prompt at the cursors current position.

member.name: P:SadConsole.Components.ClassicConsoleKeyboardHandler.ReplaceEmptyGlyph
member.summary: The glyph used to replace the empty characters that may be in the string sent to .

member.name: P:SadConsole.Components.ClassicConsoleKeyboardHandler.CursorLastY
member.summary: This holds the row that the virtual cursor is starting from when someone is typing.

member.name: F:SadConsole.Components.ClassicConsoleKeyboardHandler.EnterPressedAction
member.summary: This is a callback for the owner of this keyboard handler. The parameters are the component itself, the used by the handler, and the string input by the user. It's called when the user presses ENTER.

member.summary: Creates the handler with the specified prompt.
member.param: The prompt to display to the user.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Components.ClassicConsoleKeyboardHandler.OnAdded(SadConsole.IScreenObject)
member.summary: Called when this component is added to an object with a cursor; caches reference to the cursor.
member.param: The host object for the component.
member.remarks:
Makes the cursor visible, disables word breaks and the string parser, and prints the prompt.
If the host is a , it uses the property, caching reference to it. You can't change the cursor reference unless you re-add this component. If the host is a , the first instance of a cursor in the collection is used. If there is no cursor, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Components.ClassicConsoleKeyboardHandler.PrintPrompt
member.summary: Prints the prompt and locks the cursor to the column that ends at the prompt.
